byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and David E. Sanger from Tel Aviv. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, with week left before deadline on agreement to limit country's nuclear program, demands that most sanctions be lifted immediately; also says there will be no freeze on Iran's nuclear enrichment for up to decade.
lead_paragraph: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei ruled out a freeze on Iran’s sensitive nuclear work for long periods and insisted that all sanctions must be lifted immediately.

headline.main: Iran’s Supreme Leader, Khamenei, Seems to Pull Back on Nuclear Talks
headline.print_headline: Ayatollah Seems to Pull Back on Nuclear Agreements

snippet: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei ruled out a freeze on Iran’s sensitive nuclear work for long periods and insisted that all sanctions must be lifted immediately.
